Class GameModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • GameModel

  • public class GameModel
extends Observable
    The GameModel is a simple game model keeping track of player names and points. It's observed by MyTableModel For easy access to the game model, it uses the design pattern Singleton
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    oscar
    See Also:
    Observable

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addPlayer(Player player)
      Adds a Player to a list of players in the game model
      void addPoints(int playerIndex, int points)
      Adds points to a Player in the ArrayList chosen by playerIndex
      static GameModel getInstance()
      If no GameModel has been created, create and return one.
      ArrayList<Player> getPlayers()
      Gets all the players as an ArrayList

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static GameModel getInstance()
        If no GameModel has been created, create and return one. Only one instance of GameModel is allowed. All references to this object should be made using GameModel.getInstance()
        Returns:
        the one and single instance

      • addPoints

        public void addPoints(int playerIndex,
                      int points)
        Adds points to a Player in the ArrayList chosen by playerIndex
        Parameters:
        playerIndex - the index of the player in the ArrayList
        points - the amount of points to add to the player

      • addPlayer

        public void addPlayer(Player player)
        Adds a Player to a list of players in the game model
        Parameters:
        player - the player to be added
        See Also:
        Player

      • getPlayers

        public ArrayList<Player> getPlayers()
        Gets all the players as an ArrayList
        Returns:
        the ArrayList of players
